alert.note: Alert for Central Interior (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 1:30PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...High Water Continues Along the Yukon River And Lower Nowitna Rivers... The ice jam near the Kokrines Bible Camp broke early Sunday morning and water levels dropped along the Yukon River and Lower Nowitna River. Water levels at Tanana have dropped about 2.5 feet since Saturday, and roads in Tanana are now above water. High water on the Yukon River upstream of Tanana will make its way down to Tanana today and Tuesday, causing water levels to fluctuate slightly. It is expected that any water level rise at Tanana will be less than one foot through Tuesday. Water will continue to slowly drain back into the river over the next several days. Some poorly drained areas like old sloughs will keep water for many days. Ice that is up on shore will remain for many days until it melts.
